intro: Crotalaria cistoides, commonly known as the bladderpod cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has hairy stems and compound leaves, and its pods are inflated, giving it the common name "bladderpod." It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry conditions. Crotalaria cistoides is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial in agricultural settings.
